cs113.calendar.guiview
Class AdminArea

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  cs113.calendar.guiview.AdminArea
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class AdminArea
extends javax.swing.JPanel

AdminArea lets the user create and delete users. The user is presented with a list of current users, and can delete each one, and has a button to create a user.

Author:
Owen Healy
See Also:
Serialized Form

Nested Class Summary
private  class AdminArea.ClearMessageListener
          Listens for when the user DOES ANYTHING so we THINK it's safe to clear the error text at the bottom.
private  class AdminArea.CreateListener
          Listens for the button at the bottom that says "Create".
private  class AdminArea.DeleteListener
          There are these buttons next to the rows of the list that say "Delete" and if you press it this listener gets invoked and deletes the user.
private  class AdminArea.UserCreationRow
          A place where the user can type in the info about a new user and then click "Create" and it gets created!!:):):)
(package private)  class AdminArea.UserRow
          A row in the list of users.

Method Detail

redoUsers

private void redoUsers()
Reconstruct the list of users. If the currentCreation is non-null, it will be added to the end of the list.

createUser

private void createUser()
Sets up user creation.

cancelCreateUser

private void cancelCreateUser()
Gets rid of user creation.

createUser

private void createUser(java.lang.String id,
                        java.lang.String name)
Actually do the user creation. In response to somebody pressing enter. If the user can't actually be created, put some error message in the status bar.

Parameters:
id - The user ID.
name - The user's full name.

makeLabel

                                     java.lang.Object... args)
Helper function to make a nice little label.

Parameters:
text - The contents -- this is a printf-like format string.
args - The format parameters.
Returns:
A JLabel with the given formatted text.
